contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=February 2009}} '''Yasmeen Hameed''' is a [[Pakistan]]i [[Urdu]] poet. Yasmeen Hameed has over 25 years of experience in the fields of literature, art and education. She is presently working as ‘Writer in Residence’ in the Social Sciences Department at [[Lahore University of Management Sciences]].<ref name=dailytimes20101104>{{cite news |title=A nostalgic poetic journey |url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2010\11\04\story_4-11-2010_pg3_6 |work=[[Daily Times (Pakistan)]] |date=4 November 2010 |accessdate=24 February 2011 }}</ref> Yasmeen Hameed’s original literary contributions are her five books of poetry published in Urdu in 1988, 1991, 1996, 2001 and 2007. She has contributed to English writing through translation of contemporary Urdu poetry into English.<ref name=dailytimes20101104/> She has edited (in English), issues of ''Pakistani Literature'' published by the [[Pakistan Academy of Letters]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Bi-annual English journal: Number of women writers exceptional: PAL |url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2008\03\06\story_6-3-2008_pg11_8 |work=[[Daily Times (Pakistan)]] |date=6 March 2008 |accessdate=24 February 2011 }}</ref> She has written scripts in English for Cultural/Fashion shows sponsored by The Government of Pakistan, performed in London in 1995 and Washington in 1996 and in the World Cup Cricket Cultural Festival in Pakistan in 1996. She has also contributed a monthly column to the Books & Authors supplement of The Daily Dawn. She owns and has developed The Lahore Alma School in Defence Housing Authority, Lahore. Additionally, she has interviewed a number of renowned Pakistani literary personalities on Pakistan Television and has participated widely in poetry symposia at national and international levels. == Education == M. Sc. :Nutrition<br /> Punjab University – Lahore (1972)<br /> B. Sc. :Home Economics- Home Economics College<br /> Punjab University – Lahore (1970) == Original works == Published five books of poetry in Urdu: {| class="wikitable" |- ! Title ! Year Published ! Pages |- | Pas-e-Aina | 1988 | 160 |- | Hisar-e-be-Dar-o-Deevar | 1991 | 160 |- | Aadha Din aur Aadhi Raat | 1996 | 237 |- | Fana bhi eik Saraab | 2001 | 216 |- | Doosri Zindagi (Collected poems, 1988–2001) | 2007 | 700 |} == Awards for poetry and literature == '''Tamgha-e-Imtiaz''' for Literature awarded by the Government of Pakistan (August 14, 2008)<br /> '''Fatima Jinnah Medal for Literature''' awarded by the Government of Punjab on International<br /> '''Women’s Day''', March 8, 2006.<br /> '''Ahmed Nadeem Qasmi Award''' for Poetry (2001) for the collection, Fana bhi eik saraab.<br /> '''Hijra Award''' for Hijra year 1417 (June 1996- May 1997):<br /> '''Dr Allama Mohammad Iqbal Award''' for the collection, Aadha Din aur Aadhi Raat. == Works to be published == *Contemporary Verse from Pakistan (English) *Fifth collection of poetry (Urdu) titled Bay- samar pairhon ki khwahish. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Hameed, Yasmeen | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hameed, Yasmeen}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Lahore]] [[Category:Pakistani poets]] [[Category:Pakistani writers]] [[Category:Pakistani humanitarians]] [[Category:Writers from Lahore]] {{Pakistan-poet-stub}}
